intro: Helicodiceros crinitus, commonly known as the hairy helicodiceros, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it is often found in coastal and inland regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
